s: Amazon continues to face scrutiny from antitrust regulators. It currently faces a wide-ranging antitrust investigation into its business practices by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC). The FTC's antitrust probe was reported to be focusing on Amazon Web Services as of December 2021.

t: More brands are leaving Amazon, but the strategy could backfire
s: January 27, 2020 - A growing number of companies are leaving Amazon, but shoppers can still find their products on the site.

3 days ago - The company launched in 2005 in Dubai, United Arab Emirates and served multiple areas across the Middle East. On March 28, 2017, Amazon acquired Souq.com for $580 million. The company was re-branded as Amazon and its infrastructure was used to expand Amazon's online platform in the Middle East.

t: List of mergers and acquisitions by Amazon - Wikipedia
s: February 13, 2025 - Amazon has diversified its acquisition portfolio into several market sectors, with its largest acquisition being the purchase of the grocery store chain Whole Foods Market for $13.7 billion on June 16, 2017.

The e-commerce giant acquired MGM, the 97-year-old film and television studio, for $8.45 billion — or about 40 percent more than other prospective buyers, including Apple and Comcast. This acquisition was a key move for Amazon to bolster its crucial Prime membership.

t: Selling with the enemy: Why rival retailers embrace Amazon.com | Reuters
s: April 9, 2019 - From Nike Inc and Under Armour Inc to Lands' End Inc and Levi Strauss & Co, major brands are distributing clothing and accessories directly through Amazon.com, attracted by more than 100 million members of Amazon's loyalty club Prime and its advanced delivery network.

s: August 10, 2023 - Amazon is getting rid of dozens of in-house clothing brands as it faces a potential antitrust lawsuit from the FTC, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal.

t: Amazon’s new 'Buy for Me' feature helps customers find and buy products from other brands’ sites

Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.
